channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7721] Atomic multi-row mutations in META
item.description:
Thanks to Lars' local transactions patch (HBASE-5229), we can entertain the possibility of doing local transactions within META regions.

We need this mainly for region splits and merges. Clients scan the META concurrent to the split/merge operations, and to prevent the clients from seeing overlapping region boundaries or holes in META, we just through hoops. For more backgroun, see BlockingMetaScannerVisitor, HBASE-5986, and my comments at https://reviews.apache.org/r/8716/.

Now, for the actual implementation options:
1. As outlined in http://hadoop-hbase.blogspot.com/2012_02_01_archive.html,

  • We have to implement a Custom RegionSplitPolicy for the META regions to ensure that a table's regions are always co-located in the same META region. Then we can add MultiRowMutationEndpoint as a system level coprocessor, and use it for META operations.
    2. Do smt like HBASE-7716, and expose local atomic multi-row operations as a native API.
    3. Move META to zookeeper. Use zookeeper.multi.

Then we can change region split / merge logic to make use of atomic META operations.

Thoughts, suggestions?

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Nice.

We have to implement a Custom RegionSplitPolicy for the META regions to ensure that a table's regions are always co-located in the same META region.

Could punt on this a while given .META. does not split currently (We should allow it split one day to spread the load and to make it so less damage done if only a piece of .META. is offline because of server crash rather than all).

Move META to zookeeper. Use zookeeper.multi.

Why you say this Enis?

I think doing this change would make us generally more robust around region state.

Could punt on this a while given .META. does not split currently (We should allow it split one day to spread the load and to make it so less damage done if only a piece of .META. is offline because of server crash rather than all).

Agreed. It means we do not actually need a split policy for now. In HBASE-7748, I added a delimited key prefix split policy, which can be deployed in META table.
Do you remember why we have disabled META splits in the first place?

Why you say this Enis?

Just to list our options. If we move to ZK in META, we don't need this issue. However, that discussion is out of scope for this issue I guess.

Do you remember why we have disabled META splits in the first place?

Because I remember our buddy Cosmin found it didn't work and for a while we swore we'd fix it and then a few folks got burned by it not working so (Todd IIRC) just disabled it till it got fixed... which has still to happen.

Removing ROOT should happen first. Then .META. location would be in zk. Later, if we could split, could keep all region locations in zk and let the client sort the list it gets from zk.

Splitting .META. would be good to have; distribute the load and mitigate the case where regionserver carrying the single .META. goes down.

Is there a particular reason why META has the region as key instead of table?
having the regions inside the table row should give the transaction on the table modification for free right?

Matteo Bertozzi You would have .META. rows just be table names? And then the region name would be column qualifiers? We'd have two columns per region – one to hold regioninfo and another to hold the servername – or we'd just have the one cell that had both regioninfo and servername in it (probably the former...) Jesse Yates suggested something along this direction in hbase-2600 but not as radical (or 'clean') as your idea. I like your suggestion. Stick it over on hbase-2600?

Is there a particular reason why META has the region as key instead of table?

I think it was just designed that way from the get go.

having the regions inside the table row should give the transaction on the table modification for free right?

I think this ties down to the same discussion that is happening at HBASE-7716. We could definitely use table names as rows, not sure whether we expose the actual META schema to the clients as an API (through MetaScanner or MetaReader). Hopefully not.
But in the mean time that we fix HBASE-2600, we can go with this patch I think.

But in the mean time that we fix HBASE-2600, we can go with this patch I think.

Yes, sure. My comment was just a clarification request on why each region is a row in META, and I think that "it was just designed that way" is enough as answer. I was not planning to change the META layout, and I've still have to evaluate if having the table as row key in META is good or not.
Put up an initial patch at https://reviews.apache.org/r/9314/. Reviews welcome.

Went through half of the patch.
Locally I got this failure:


testShutdownSimpleFixup(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestSplitTransactionOnCluster)  Time elapsed: 63.304 sec  <<< FAILURE!

java.lang.AssertionError: Waiting too long for daughter regions

  at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestSplitTransactionOnCluster.awaitDaughters(TestSplitTransactionOnCluster.java:955)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestSplitTransactionOnCluster.testShutdownSimpleFixup(TestSplitTransactionOnCluster.java:374)

  at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
Any chance to get this for 0.94.6? It's blocking HBASE-7403 which will be nice to have...
This seems like a pretty involved change for 0.94. What do other folks think?
This is definitely involved, and I would not recommend for 0.94. However, i think we can find a way to backport online merges without this.
Enis Soztutar You going to commit this one or you think there is stuff to do still? Good on you.

You going to commit this one or you think there is stuff to do still?

Thanks boss. I wanted to test it on an actual cluster first. Could not get to it last week. I'll do the test, and if positive, will commit.

I think we should try this for 0.94. It would allow for online schema alter (and with HBASE-7403) online schema merge.
You could consider HBase unfit for production use if changing some CF/Table attributes involves downtime (disabling and enabling a table is downtime).

This seems to be a very nice feature. The headache in seeing if a region is split or not is totally avoided.
When we did Sec index impl, we introduced some new hooks in the Split flow that will help me to make make Puts for the index region and then for the main region.
But depended on the SSH capabiliites to handle the failures. This seems to be a very good feature.

I think we should try this for 0.94. It would allow for online schema alter (and with HBASE-7403) online schema merge.

I totally agree with this statement. I'm eager to see online merge in.
We'd need HBASE-7305 as well, no?
Trying hadoopqa.

patch is clear

+1 from me
Ok, I'm gonna commit this one today unless objections.
Finally looked through the patch on RB. Looks good. Should maybe make the MultiRow stuff more "official" now (rather than just an endpoint we ship)

make the MultiRow stuff more "official" now (rather than just an endpoint we ship)

Definitely. This would allow wider adoption of MultiRow feature.

Should maybe make the MultiRow stuff more "official" now (rather than just an endpoint we ship)

Yes. Did you look at my proposal at HBASE-7716? That is one way of adding this as a core functionality.
w.r.t. HBASE-7716, Matt left some comment there.
I already +1'd it.
